symptoms.name: Pain
symptoms.severity: Variable, depending on size and location

symptoms.name: Pruritus
symptoms.severity: Variable, depending on size and location

symptoms.name: Psychosocial distress
symptoms.pattern: Can cause considerable distress due to appearance

physical_findings: Flat, papular, or pedunculated growths on the genital mucosa
Commonly occur around the vaginal introitus, under the foreskin of the uncircumcised penis, and on the shaft of the circumcised penis
Can occur at multiple sites in the anogenital epithelium or within the anogenital tract (e.g., cervix, vagina, urethra, perineum, perianal skin, anus, or scrotum)
Intra-anal warts are observed predominantly in persons who have had receptive anal intercourse

supportive: Biopsy (if lesions are atypical, uncertain diagnosis, no response to therapy, or worsening during therapy)
HPV testing is not recommended for diagnosis

differential_diagnoses: Normal skin variations (pearly penile papules, parafrenular glands, Fordyce spots, vestibular papillae, sebaceous cysts)
Other papules (syphilis, molluscum contagiosum, lichen planus, psoriasis, condyloma lata)

Benign or malignant neoplastic lesions (papillomatoses of vulva, nevi, verrucous carcinoma, invasive carcinoma, seborrhoeic keratosis, Bowen's disease, Buschke-Löwenstein disease, pigmented or unpigmented grade 2-3 intraepithelial neoplasia, lymphangioma)
